facts.name: Stonewall Riots
facts.fact: The Stonewall Riots, which began on June 28, 1969, were a pivotal event in the LGBTQ+ rights movement, sparking the modern LGBTQ+ rights movement.

facts.name: Pride Month
facts.fact: Pride Month is celebrated every June to commemorate the Stonewall Riots and to celebrate LGBTQ+ history, culture, and achievements.

facts.name: Homosexuality Removed from DSM
facts.fact: December 15, 1973 - The American Psychiatric Association removed homosexuality from its Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders (DSM).

facts.name: GLAAD
facts.fact: GLAAD, originally founded as the Gay & Lesbian Alliance Against Defamation in 1985, works to promote fair and accurate representation of LGBTQ+ people in the media.

facts.name: Obergefell v. Hodges
facts.fact: OnJune 26, 2015 the U.S. Supreme Court ruled that same-sex marriage is a constitutional right, legalizing it across all 50 states.

facts.name: Same-Sex Marriage
facts.fact: The first country to legalize same-sex marriage was the Netherlands on April 1, 2001.

facts.name: Lambda Legal
facts.fact: Lambda Legal, founded in 1973, is a national organization that fights for the civil rights of LGBTQ+ people and those living with HIV through litigation and advocacy.

facts.name: Harvey Milk Elected
facts.fact: Harvey Milk was elected to the San Francisco Board of Supervisors, becoming one of the first openly gay elected officials in the U.S.

facts.name: The National LGBTQ Task Force
facts.fact: Established in 1973, the National LGBTQ Task Force advocates for LGBTQ+ rights and social justice through policy work, organizing, and activism.

facts.name: Transgender Day of Remembrance (TDOR)
facts.fact: Transgender Day of Remembrance is observed annually on November 20 to honor and remember those who have lost their lives due to anti-transgender violence.

facts.name: The Trevor Project
facts.fact: Founded in 1998, The Trevor Project provides crisis intervention and suicide prevention services to LGBTQ+ youth.

facts.name: Laverne Cox Barbie Doll
facts.fact: March 2, 2016 - Mattel released a Barbie doll modeled after Laverne Cox, the first transgender Barbie doll, celebrating her contributions to the LGBTQ+ community.
